SENT.plain: We present an elderly female patient with fever, aplastic anemia, arthralgic symptoms and atypical pneumonia
Serological and clinical findings suggested Parvovirus B19 and Chlamydophila pneumoniae infection

These supposed infections delayed the recognition of underlying sarcoidosis which definitive diagnosis was reached through a lung biopsy and histological demonstration of nonnecrotizing granulomas containing giant cells and noncaseating epithelioid cells
The present case highlights the potential difficulty to diagnose sarcoidosis in the presence of unusual infections which may complicate the course of this disease
